required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Genetic Factors in the Development of Idiopathic Osteoarthritis of the Knee in the Kazakh Population

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to identify genetic determinants of susceptibility to idiopathic osteoarthritis of the knee . It will assist in predicting individual risks of disease progression and would help to clarify pathophysiologic mechanisms of idiopathic osteoarthritis of the knee

primary_outcome.measure: enotyping for the SNP associated with liver cirrhosis
primary_outcome.description: Genotype frequency of SNP in the study genes of participants and control participants.

arm_group.description: patients with idiopathic osteoarthritis of the knee
patients without idiopathic osteoarthritis of the knee

intervention.description: SNP analysis of the DNA obtained from peripheral blood sample

overall_official.affiliation: Scientific center of traumatology and orthopedics named after academician Batpenova ND

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of the Laboratory of Experimental Medicine
